captions.text: I need you
I fall in love and farewell with the pieces
That you have left inside me
How about you
I need you

When I’m trying to forget you 
everything falls down

Endless time, 
in all these spaces

Your breath that is 
deep fills the room

The pieces of the promises 
and traces of memories

I collect them together 
and spend the day
How about you
I need you

When I’m trying to forget 
you everything falls down
Endless time, in all these spaces
Your breath that is deep fills the room
I can't get over you.
I can't get over you.

You just keep shining on 
and on through my time.
I can't get over you.
I can't get over you.
I need you

When I think of you 
the time freezes
I’m trying but it’s not working

Every time I breathe your 
memory talks to me

Left here, 
letting you go is my work

Like a movie, 
or a lie you will not come back
Come back to me.

comments.text:
Translated from Korean to Japanese on google.

私はあなたが必要

私は今日もこのように私の中に残されたあなたの部分と
また、恋に落ちる再び別れをしてい。
あなたはどうか。

私はあなたが必要です。
板消去するたびに、すべてが崩れ落ちて取り除か。
無限の時間に、このすべての空間に
濃く染まった君のその息だけがいっぱい。

私は今日もこのように私の中に残された約束の断片。記憶の跡。
せっかく合わせながら、また一日を過ごし。
あなたはどうか。

私はあなたが必要です。
板消去するたびに、すべてが崩れ落ちて取り除か。
無限の時間に、このすべての空間に
濃く染まった君のその息だけがいっぱい。

I can not get over you。
I can not get over you。
you just keep shining on and on through my time。

私はあなたが必要です。
あなた思い浮かべるたびに、その時間が凍りついて取り除か。
努力してもダメ。私は息をするたびにあなたの記憶が私に声をかける怪しく。

残されることも、離れて過ごすのも、すべて私の分け前だろう。
まるで映画のように、嘘であるかのように戻って上げないだろう。

Come back to me。

comments.author: 효자손

comments.text:
The song represents the cycle that many people go through after a break 
up.. sometimes you'll be fine and able to deal with the pain but then all 
of a sudden you miss that person and you relapse into that pain of missing 
them and being upset over the break up and you have to go through the cycle 
of getting over them all over again. This video is somewhat of a metaphor 
for that. She wakes up and she doesn't remember the pain she felt of losing 
her lover but when she sees him and remembers she goes through all that 
pain again feeling like she can't breathe and "dies" and you see multiple 
of her on the floor at the end and that just represents all the cycles of 
pain she's gone through. Does that make sense? I'm not sure if I explained 
that well lol
